thread.title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers agree to deal Lou Williams to Rockets | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: NBA trade rumors: Lakers agree to deal Lou Williams to Rockets | NBA | Sporting News

author: Gabrielle Mcmillen Omnisport
title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers agree to deal Lou Williams to Rockets | NBA | Sporting News
text:
February 21, 2017 8:12pm EST February 21, 2017 8:12pm EST NBA, News, Houston Rockets, Los Angeles Lakers, English, Louis Williams, Cory Brewer In return, the Lakers reportedly will receive Corey Brewer and a first-round pick from Houston. Lou Williams (Getty Images) 
Updated at 8:12 p.m. ET 
Updated at 8:12 p.m. ET 
After much chatter, it seems like Magic Johnson's first trade as president of the Lakers is almost complete. 
Los Angeles will trade veteran guard Lou Williams, 31, to the Rockets in return for forward Corey Brewer and a first-round draft pick, according to The Vertical . 
Williams, a Sixth Man of the Year candidate, thanked the city of Los Angeles Tuesday night. Thanx for the love L.A, I've enjoyed my stay. â€” Lou Williams (@TeamLou23) February 22, 2017 
It's been a busy day for the Lakers after team president Jeanie Buss fired fired general manager Mitch Kupchak and named Johnson as president of basketball operations. Buss also fired her brother, Jim Buss, from his position as vice president of basketball operations. 
Williams is averaging 18.6 points, 2.3 assists and 2.3 rebounds per game, while Brewer averaging 4.2 points, 2.0 rebounds and 1.1 assists per game. 
Both have two years remaining in their respective contracts. Watch This
